upgradePage.heroTitle: Pick the plan that powers your document intelligence
upgradePage.heroSubtitle: Compare DocuIQ subscription tiers to match your team’s scale, governance, and collaboration needs. Every plan includes secure processing, multilingual coverage, and AI-assisted insights.

starter.name: Starter
starter.bestFor: Best for: Individuals exploring AI-powered document understanding.
features: AI document Q&A with page references
Access to DocuIQ public LLM model

pro.name: Pro
pro.bestFor: Best for: Teams analyzing reports collaboratively.
features: Upload up to 2 000 documents (max 500 MB each)

enterprise.name: Enterprise
enterprise.bestFor: Best for: Large organizations needing scale, privacy, and integration.
features: Dedicated vector database (S3 / PostgreSQL / Pinecone / Milvus)
Third-party integrations (Slack, Jira, Notion, Teams, etc.)

upgradePage.addonsSubtitle: Expand storage, increase throughput, or tailor the experience with flexible add-ons.
upgradePage.comparisonSubtitle: See how Starter, Pro, and Enterprise stack up across ingestion, collaboration, and governance.

faq.q: Can we trial Pro before upgrading?
faq.a: Yes. Request a 14-day pilot with sample data or bring your own dataset. Our team will help with setup.

faq.q: Do you offer discounts for education or non-profits?
faq.a: We offer discounted Pro and Enterprise tiers for qualified organizations. Contact us at hello@docuiq.ai to learn more.

faq.q: How quickly can we deploy the Enterprise plan?
faq.a: Typical enterprise rollouts complete within 2–4 weeks depending on SSO and data integrations. We help with migration planning.

upgradePage.feedbackPro: Unlock collaboration by upgrading to the Pro plan below.
upgradePage.feedbackEnterprise: Enterprise includes private deployments, SSO, and dedicated onboarding.
upgradePage.feedbackUpgradeSuccess: You are now on the Pro plan. Enjoy advanced collaboration features!

sections.title: Getting started
sections.summary: Lay the foundations for a successful DocuIQ workspace.

articles.title: Upload documents
articles.body: Go to Documents → Upload to drag-and-drop PDFs, DOCX, PPTX, HTML, and more. We queue ingestion automatically and show progress in the activity feed.

articles.title: Connect cloud drives
articles.body: Open Documents → Connect sources to link Google Drive, OneDrive, or S3 buckets. Schedule sync windows to keep content fresh.

articles.title: Invite teammates
articles.body: Navigate to Settings → Workspace to invite teammates by email. Assign viewer or editor roles based on how they collaborate.

sections.title: Workspace admin
sections.summary: Stay in control of security, billing, and compliance.

articles.title: Manage seats
articles.body: Workspace owners can add or remove users and reassign seats at any time. Billing updates are reflected on the next invoice.

articles.title: Configure SSO
articles.body: Enterprise customers can enable SAML or OAuth SSO from Settings → Security. Contact support for SCIM provisioning.

articles.title: Audit activity
articles.body: Use Settings → Activity log to review uploads, deletions, and permission changes across the workspace.

sections.title: Troubleshooting
sections.summary: Fix the most common ingestion and search issues quickly.

articles.title: Why is ingestion stuck?
articles.body: Large documents may take a few minutes to index. Refresh the Documents page or check Release notes for active maintenance windows.

articles.title: Search returns no results
articles.body: Ensure the document finished indexing and that your query includes relevant keywords. Try the advanced filters for date or source.

articles.title: Chat responses feel off
articles.body: Open the thread menu and share feedback so we can improve grounding. Provide the document name and question you asked.

sections.title: Best practices
sections.summary: Make DocuIQ part of everyday workflows.

articles.title: Create shared collections
articles.body: Group related documents into shared folders so teams can find approved content quickly.

articles.title: Track adoption
articles.body: Use the dashboard usage chart and release notes to plan enablement sessions.

articles.title: Educate with snippets
articles.body: Save reusable prompts and share them in team channels so everyone benefits from curated patterns.

faq.q: How do I limit who sees sensitive documents?
faq.a: Use workspace roles and per-folder permissions inside Documents → Collections. Only editors with granted access can open restricted files.

faq.q: Can I export answers or references?
faq.a: Yes. In any saved analysis, select the ••• menu → Export to download the transcript, references, and inline citations.

faq.q: Where can I see current system status?
faq.a: Visit Release notes for maintenance news or subscribe to status emails from Settings → Notifications.

cta.title: Still need help?
cta.description: Chat with us or email support@docuiq.ai and we’ll get back to you within one business day.

releaseNotes.heroSubtitle: Weekly updates on features, improvements, and fixes across the platform.

highlights: Improved ingestion progress indicators with real-time status
changes: New multi-file upload queue with pause and resume support
Search results now surface top referenced documents with previews
Billing page shows upcoming invoice estimates
Admins can download activity logs as CSV
Chat answers include inline page callouts
Improved support for large HTML files

highlights: Faster onboarding flow for enterprise SSO

termsPolicies.heroSubtitle: Understand how DocuIQ handles data, privacy, and acceptable use.

sections.title: Terms of service
sections.description: These terms describe how you may use DocuIQ and your responsibilities as a customer.
points: DocuIQ is licensed per workspace seat. Sharing accounts is not permitted.
You retain ownership of uploaded content. We store encrypted copies solely to provide the service.
We may suspend access if usage violates applicable laws or harms system stability.

items.title: Encryption
items.body: All documents are encrypted at rest with AES-256 and in transit with TLS 1.2+.

items.title: Retention
items.body: Delete a document to remove it from active storage. Backups are purged within 30 days.

items.title: Access
items.body: Only vetted DocuIQ personnel can access production systems, and solely for approved support requests.

sections.title: Acceptable use
points: Do not upload content that infringes on intellectual property or includes sensitive PII without consent.
Automated scraping, spam, or denial-of-service activity is prohibited.
Report suspected abuse to legal@docuiq.ai so we can investigate.

termsPolicies.questionsSubtitle: We’re happy to share audit reports, DPAs, or answer vendor questionnaires.

bugReport.heroSubtitle: Help us reproduce the issue so we can roll out a fix quickly.

placeholders.summary: e.g. Unable to download PDF export
placeholders.steps: List the clicks, inputs, or API calls that lead to the bug

tips.title: What to include
items: Document IDs or titles involved in the bug
Any console errors or HTTP status codes
If the bug blocks production, mention the impact

bugReport.success: Thanks for the details! Your email app should open with a draft—press send and we’ll follow up shortly.
bugReport.error: We couldn’t open your email client. Please email support@docuiq.ai with the details.

contactSales.heroSubtitle: Tell us a little about your data sources, security requirements, and team goals. Our specialists respond within one business day with a tailored rollout plan and pricing for Enterprise deployments.
contactSales.highlightOne: Private cloud or on-prem deployment options
contactSales.highlightThree: Integration support for Slack, Jira, Notion, Teams, and more
contactSales.formSubtitle: We will follow up with a tailored success plan and enterprise pricing.
contactSales.desiredPlanLabel: Which plan are you interested in?
